verses.plain: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

tokens.t: In thee, O
, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

verses.plain: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

tokens.t: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

verses.plain: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.

tokens.t: For thou
my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.

verses.plain: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.

tokens.t: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou
my strength.

verses.plain: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.

tokens.t: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O
God of truth.

verses.plain: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the LORD.

tokens.t: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the

verses.plain: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

tokens.t: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

verses.plain: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

tokens.t: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

verses.plain: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.

tokens.t: Have mercy upon me, O
, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief,
, my soul and my belly.

verses.plain: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

tokens.t: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

verses.plain: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

tokens.t: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

verses.plain: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

tokens.t: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

verses.plain: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

tokens.t: For I have heard the slander of many: fear
on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

verses.plain: But I trusted in thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my God.

tokens.t: But I trusted in thee, O
: I said, Thou
my God.

verses.plain: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

tokens.t: My times
in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

verses.plain: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.

tokens.t: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.

verses.plain: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.

tokens.t: Let me not be ashamed, O
; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed,
let them be silent in the grave.

verses.plain: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

tokens.t: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

verses.plain: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

tokens.t: how great
thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee;
thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

verses.plain: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

tokens.t: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

verses.plain: Blessed be the LORD: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

tokens.t: Blessed
the
: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

verses.plain: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

tokens.t: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

verses.plain: O love the LORD, all ye his saints: for the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

tokens.t: O love the
, all ye his saints:
the
preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

verses.plain: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the LORD.

tokens.t: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the

footnotes.text: my…: Heb. to me for a rock of strength
a broken…: Heb. a vessel that perisheth
